data: Status Epilepticus: Clinical or electrographic seizures of greater than 5 minutes or recurrent seizure activity without recovery in between episodes
Refractory Status Epilepticus: Persistent clinical or electrographic seizures despite benzodiazepines and one anti-epileptic drug
dose range: 1 to 4 mg, IV, as directed, seizure activity, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: inj
dose range: 5 to 10 mg, IV, as directed, seizure activity, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: inj
20 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
2,000 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj
100 mg, IV, q8h, drug form: inj
150 mg, IV, q8h, drug form: inj
If clinical or electrographic seizures continue despite Level 1 therapy for greater than 5 minutes then proceed to Level 2
RASS goal of 0, Alert and Calm
RASS goal of -1, Drowsy, sustained eye opening and eye contact for more than 10 seconds to voice
RASS goal of -2, Light sedation, eye opening and eye contact for less than 10 seconds to voice
RASS goal of -3, Moderate sedation, movement but no eye contact to voice
RASS goal of -4, Deep sedation, no response to voice, only rousable to pain
Priority: Next Available Appointment, Reason For Exam: status epilepticus, Schedule as: Inpatient, Scheduling Locations: SPH EEG EP Lab, Portable
Nurse to apply continuous EEG module at bedside
200 mg, IV, as directed, drug form: inj
titrate, IV, 50 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 80 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: as per MD for seizure activity and/or burst suppression
titrate, IV, 50 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 80 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: as per MD for seizure activity and/or burst suppression
10 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj
midazolam titratable infusion (1 mg/mL) in NS standard
titrate, IV, 5 mg/h starting rate, 0 mg/h minimum rate, 30 mg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: as per MD for seizure activity and /or burst suppression

10 mg, NG-tube, BID, drug form: tab
If clinical or electrographic seizures persist then proceed to Level 3

To be discussed with ICU and Epilepsy attending. Maintain continuous EEG monitoring. Maintain IV anti-epileptic therapy for 24 to 48 hours with EEG complete seizure cessation or burst suppression. Wean off intravenous therapies to be done in consultation with Epilepsy Attending
1.5 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
